intro: Siphocampylus andinus, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 5,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Siphocampylus andinus is often found in open, sunny habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
